$interpreted: Tindoiimu: (Seems like those two didn't follow me... Are they... compatriots of Juan-Yun's?)
Tindoiimu: (I don't understand... I feel so lost...)
Tindoiimu: Are... Are you awake? Can you hear me?
Uzziah: ......
Tindoiimu: ...Open your eyes.
Uzziah: ......
Tindoiimu: Come on, I didn't save you just so I could talk to a corpse. Wake up!
Uzziah: Hurgh... *cough*...
Tindoiimu: What is it...?!
Tindoiimu: (Is... Is that the Sdorica core they were talking about? How could the legendary dragon...)
Tindoiimu: (What astonishing power...!)
Tindoiimu: (...With this power... I could be as strong as them... Just like Juan-Yun... I could...)
Tindoiimu: ...I could...
Tindoiimu: —Take it all back!
Tindoiimu: ......
Uzziah: ......
Tindoiimu: Hmm... You were right, this isn't like me. I would never do such a thing. At least... at least...
Tindoiimu: ...I couldn't let that be taken away from me, too...
Uzziah: ......
Uzziah: ...You have passed the test.
Tindoiimu: ...You...?!
Tindoiimu: ...When did you wake up... Wait, you were pretending the whole time?
Uzziah: The wound is real. I'm close to death. That's why I needed to test you.
Uzziah: If you'd done it, I'd have used what remained of my strength to kill you. The dragon core mustn't fall into the wrong hands.
Tindoiimu: What the heck is a dragon core...
Uzziah: The essence of Sdorica's being.
Uzziah: Vendacti sacrificed herself to cast the seal and send the dragon into its eternal slumber. But the dragon was too powerful, and it couldn't be sealed away completely...
Uzziah: And so, the remaining outer cores of the dragon were given to others, entrusted to carry them until their flesh crumbled, and they can be passed on once again.
Tindoiimu: ...Is that what you meant... by Guardsman?
Uzziah: Yes. As for the person you seek... That group, their homelands and objectives...
Uzziah: Once you've taken on the dragon core, it'll tell you everything.
Uzziah: You'll have what you need to stop them.
Uzziah: But... Nobody can ever really shoulder the power of the dragon. Not only the Guardsmen, but all life around them, will succumb to madness in the end.
Uzziah: ...So the Guardsmen must walk alone.
Tindoiimu: Wait... You're telling me all this... because you want me to become the next Guardsman?
Uzziah: I don't appear to have any other choice now. But you may refuse, if you wish.
Tindoiimu: ...Don't... Don't you want me to accept?
Uzziah: ...The Guardsman before me would rather have given up everything to save me, even if the suffering it caused him was unbearable.
Uzziah: When I chose to become the Guardsman, I swore to never let myself end up in the same situation.
Uzziah: ...Should you refuse, the cycle of destiny will end with me.
Tindoiimu: ...But if we can choose, then how is it our destiny?
Uzziah: ...You'll understand when you've lived as long as I have.
Uzziah: The decisions that we have no choice but to make, are those that become our destiny.
Tindoiimu: ......
Uzziah: I've told you what you want and need to know. Now, you must answer.
Tindoiimu: ...Do you... Do you have a name?
Uzziah: ...Uzziah.
Tindoiimu: Uzziah, I'm Tindoiimu.
Tindoiimu: ...Thank you, for letting me — for letting me decide for myself, for the very first time.
Tindoiimu: I've decided—
Baa Baa: Your guests have been escorted north as requested, sir.
Juan-Yun: Thank you... Hmm?

Model.Text: (Seems like those two didn't follow me... Are they... compatriots of Juan-Yun's?)
(I don't understand... I feel so lost...)
Are... Are you awake? Can you hear me?
...Open your eyes.
Come on, I didn't save you just so I could talk to a corpse. Wake up!
Hurgh... *cough*...
What is it...?!
(Is... Is that the Sdorica core they were talking about? How could the legendary dragon...)
(What astonishing power...!)
(...With this power... I could be as strong as them... Just like Juan-Yun... I could...)
...I could...
—Take it all back!
Hmm... You were right, this isn't like me. I would never do such a thing. At least... at least...
...I couldn't let that be taken away from me, too...
...You have passed the test.
...When did you wake up... Wait, you were pretending the whole time?
The wound is real. I'm close to death. That's why I needed to test you.
If you'd done it, I'd have used what remained of my strength to kill you. The dragon core mustn't fall into the wrong hands.
What the heck is a dragon core...
The essence of Sdorica's being.
Vendacti sacrificed herself to cast the seal and send the dragon into its eternal slumber. But the dragon was too powerful, and it couldn't be sealed away completely...
And so, the remaining outer cores of the dragon were given to others, entrusted to carry them until their flesh crumbled, and they can be passed on once again.
...Is that what you meant... by Guardsman?
Yes. As for the person you seek... That group, their homelands and objectives...
Once you've taken on the dragon core, it'll tell you everything.
You'll have what you need to stop them.
But... Nobody can ever really shoulder the power of the dragon. Not only the Guardsmen, but all life around them, will succumb to madness in the end.
...So the Guardsmen must walk alone.
Wait... You're telling me all this... because you want me to become the next Guardsman?
I don't appear to have any other choice now. But you may refuse, if you wish.
...Don't... Don't you want me to accept?
...The Guardsman before me would rather have given up everything to save me, even if the suffering it caused him was unbearable.
When I chose to become the Guardsman, I swore to never let myself end up in the same situation.
...Should you refuse, the cycle of destiny will end with me.
...But if we can choose, then how is it our destiny?
...You'll understand when you've lived as long as I have.
The decisions that we have no choice but to make, are those that become our destiny.
I've told you what you want and need to know. Now, you must answer.
...Do you... Do you have a name?
...Uzziah.
Uzziah, I'm Tindoiimu.
...Thank you, for letting me — for letting me decide for myself, for the very first time.
I've decided—
Your guests have been escorted north as requested, sir.
Thank you... Hmm?
